title: Classic Margherita Pizza
description: A traditional Italian pizza with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil on a crispy thin crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°C (480°F) with a pizza stone if available.
Roll out the pizza dough into a thin circle on a floured surface.
Mix crushed tomatoes with minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a 1cm border.
Tear mozzarella into pieces and distribute over the sauce.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves.
Let cool for 2 minutes, slice, and serve hot.

title: Thai Green Curry
description: A fragrant and spicy Thai curry with vegetables in a coconut milk base.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, bamboo shoots, eggplant)
2 tbsp fish sauce or soy sauce
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Pour in half of the coconut milk and stir until well combined.
Add tofu and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add vegetables and remaining coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
Add vegetable broth, fish sauce, and brown sugar.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in Thai basil leaves just before serving.
Serve hot with jasmine rice and lime wedges.

title: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken
description: Juicy grilled chicken breasts marinated in lemon, garlic, and fresh herbs.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, combine lemon juice, zest, garlic, rosemary, thyme, and olive oil.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Place chicken in a shallow dish and pour marinade over it.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (or up to 4 hours).
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade and place on grill.
Grill for 8-10 minutes per side until internal temperature reaches 75°C (165°F).
Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Serve with grilled vegetables or a fresh salad.

title: Vegan Buddha Bowl
description: A nourishing bowl packed with roasted vegetables, quinoa, chickpeas, and tahini dressing.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (sweet potato, broccoli, carrots)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Toss chickpeas and chopped vegetables with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until golden.
Massage kale or spinach with a bit of olive oil and salt.
Make tahini dressing by whisking together tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and water until smooth.
Divide quinoa between two bowls.
Top with roasted vegetables, chickpeas, and fresh greens.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A classic Roman pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino Romano, Parmesan, and plenty of black pepper.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, fry pancetta in a large pan until crispy.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta.
Remove pan from heat and add hot pasta to the pancetta.
Quickly add egg mixture, tossing constantly to create a creamy sauce.
Add reserved pasta water a little at a time if needed to reach desired consistency.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy, buttery cookies loaded with chocolate chips – a timeless favorite.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and both sugars until fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
Gradually mix in flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until golden brown around edges.
Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

title: Greek Salad
description: A refreshing Mediterranean salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper.
Add Kalamata olives to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over vegetables and toss gently to combine.
Add feta cheese cubes on top.
Let salad sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Toss gently before serving.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours.

title: Beef Tacos
description: Seasoned ground beef tacos with all your favorite toppings.
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add diced onion and garlic, cook until onion is softened.
Drain excess fat from the pan.
Add taco seasoning and water, stir to combine.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes until sauce thickens.
Warm taco shells according to package instructions.
Fill each taco shell with seasoned beef.
Top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

title: Caprese Salad
description: A simple Italian salad showcasing fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil.
instructions: Arrange tomato slices on a serving platter.
Place a slice of mozzarella on each tomato slice.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve as an appetizer or light lunch.

title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers filled with a savory quinoa, black bean, and vegetable mixture.
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds and membranes.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, and chili powder.
Stir in cooked quinoa and mix well. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture.
Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish with a little water at the bottom.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
If using cheese, sprinkle on top and bake uncovered for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

title: Salmon Teriyaki
description: Pan-seared salmon fillets glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce.
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
Place salmon skin-side up in the skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Flip salmon and cook for another 3-4 minutes until cooked through.
Remove salmon from skillet and set aside.
Pour teriyaki mixture into the skillet.
Mix cornstarch with water and add to the sauce, stirring until thickened.
Return salmon to the skillet and spoon sauce over the fillets.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions before serving.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy Italian rice dish with earthy mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 1 liter vegetable or chicken broth, warm
instructions: Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Add mushrooms and cook until golden brown. Set aside.
In the same pan, add remaining butter and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add Arborio rice and stir for 2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for liquid to absorb before adding more.
Continue for 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in cooked mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry
description: Quick and colorful stir-fry with tender chicken and crisp vegetables in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, snap peas, carrots)
instructions: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, and set aside.
Mix cornstarch with water to make a slurry.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until cooked through. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the wok.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Return chicken to the wok.
Pour in sauce mixture and stir to coat everything.
Add cornstarch slurry and cook for 1 minute until sauce thickens.
Serve hot over steamed rice.

title: Lentil Soup
description: Hearty and nutritious soup with red lentils, vegetables, and warming spices.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Add garlic, cumin, turmeric, and paprika. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer.
Cook for 25-30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Use an immersion blender to partially blend the soup for a creamy texture (optional).
Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

title: Avocado Toast
description: Simple yet satisfying breakfast or lunch with creamy avocado on toasted bread.
ingredients: Optional toppings: poached eggs, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, microgreens
instructions: Toast bread slices until golden and crispy.
Cut avocados in half, remove pit, and scoop flesh into a bowl.
Mash avocados with a fork until desired consistency.
Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper to the mashed avocado. Mix well.
Drizzle toasted bread with olive oil.
Spread avocado mixture generously on each slice.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and sea salt.
Add optional toppings if desired.
Serve immediately while toast is still warm.
